title: Cheryl Stablers new book The Hollywood Preacher is a philosophical, entertaining work that delves into the various aspects of religion.
text:
Recent release “The Hollywood Preacher” from Page Publishing author Cheryl Stabler is both captivating and cultural; this work keeps the reader mesmerized by the actions of the main characters.
(PRWEB) October 15, 2015
Cheryl Stabler, a wife, stay-at-home mother, small business owner, Christian, community activist, Managing Editor of UnCommon Gospel Magazine, devoted writer and author, has completed her new book “The Hollywood Preacher”: a religious work of fiction that details the rise and fall of a church.
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Cheryl Stabler’s poignant tale tells a story about a family, their search for a church and the journey while dealing with an unexpected turn of events.
“The Hollywood Preacher” is a fictional story of a church that rises and falls within three years. The preacher is well-known in the community, star struck, and a womanizer that has a gift with words. His anointing to teach God’s word draws in a family who is seeking a different kind of church. The family seeks a church with a strong teacher, a small congregation, and a church family that is welcoming. In this story, the family finds a new church home, so they think, and are taken aback by the fallout of what happens soon after. They stay to keep the flock/family together, but they witness the church hurt an entire community.
Readers who wish to experience this profound work can purchase “The Hollywood Preacher” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
